name: Standing Bicep Curl
how_to_perform:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, facing a flat surface where you will place the dumbbells.
2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, keeping your palms facing forward and your elbows close to your body at around 90-degree angle.
3. Engage your core muscles and keep your shoulders down and away from your ears.
4. Slowly curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping your upper arms still and only moving your forearms.
5. Pause briefly in the contracted position.
6. Then slowly reverse the movement, lowering the dumbbells back to the starting position.
7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, keeping your core tight and your movements controlled throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Standing bicep curl is a simple yet effective exercise that targets the biceps muscles, making them feel stronger.
